page.title: 03Roadside verges, Rutland
page.content: A sub-committee of the Rutland Committee of the{Leicestershire and} {Rutland Trust for Nature} {Conservation,}called the Rutland Verges Sub-Committee (RVSC) has recently been proposed.It is made up of members of the Trust and the Rutland National History Society. The provisional sub-committee had its first meeting in Uppingham on Wednesday 8th May 1985.Its function is to monitor the 23 lengths of roadside verges in Rutland which are of special natural history interest.Only one of these verges occurs in the study area. It is situated alongside the road between Ayston and Ridlington,from the field gate opposite the farm entrance at SK 856018 south to the bend at SK 858013. It is O.35 miles long.
